name: Wat Phra Kaew
description: Temple of the Emerald Buddha inside the Grand Palace complex.

name: Wat Arun
description: Temple of Dawn on the west bank of the Chao Phraya River.

name: Wat Pho
description: Famous for the Reclining Buddha and traditional massage school.

name: Chatuchak Weekend Market
description: One of the largest markets in the world with over 15,000 stalls.

name: MBK Center
description: Popular mall for electronics, fashion, and souvenirs.

name: Jim Thompson House
description: Museum of Thai silk pioneer in a traditional teak house.

name: Siam Paragon
description: Luxury shopping mall with aquarium, cinema, and high-end brands.

name: Asiatique The Riverfront
description: Outdoor night market with shops, restaurants, and a Ferris wheel.

name: Chinatown (Yaowarat)
description: Lively area known for Chinese temples and street food.

name: Bangkok Art and Culture Centre
description: Contemporary art exhibitions, performances, and events.

name: Erawan Shrine
description: Popular Hindu shrine dedicated to Brahma.

name: Lumphini Park
description: Large public park ideal for jogging and paddle boats.

name: Khao San Road
description: Backpacker hub with nightlife, food, and budget accommodations.

name: Terminal 21
description: Airport-themed shopping mall with floors themed by world cities.

name: ICONSIAM
description: High-end mall on the river with luxury brands and cultural spaces.

name: Museum of Siam
description: Interactive museum about Thai culture and identity.

name: Bangkok National Museum
description: Thailand's main museum of history and art.

name: Bang Kachao
description: Lush area known as Bangkokâ€™s 'green lung', ideal for cycling.

name: King Power Mahanakhon Skywalk
description: Skywalk with panoramic views from Bangkok's tallest building.
